snippet: The automatic spending cuts would be scary and the hit to the economy severe — but any negotiated deal is sure to be worse.
abstract: Op-Ed article by law Prof David A Super dispels misconception that failure to reach negotiated settlement on budgetary changes set to take effect on Jan 1, 2013, will enlarge deficit; says automatic cuts would be far better than any likely deal would be.
lead_paragraph: The automatic spending cuts would be scary and the hit to the economy severe — but any negotiated deal is sure to be worse.

headline.seo: Forget the Warnings: Let’s Drive Over the Fiscal Cliff!
